intro: Scaevola pubescens, commonly known as the silver scabious, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Goodeniaceae family and is characterized by its silvery, hairy foliage and clusters of small, blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal or sandy soils and is adapted to withstand drought and salt spray. Its unique appearance makes it a popular choice for ornamental gardening, while its ecological role supports various pollinators. Scaevola pubescens is also valued for its ability to thrive in harsh environmental conditions.
